<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="tx71940_36"></A>Item&nbsp;13.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Certain Relationships and Related Transactions </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><I>ATSB Securities Trust u/a/d March 31, 2003. </I>As part of its reorganization under the Prior Bankruptcy, US Airways received the $900 million
ATSB Guarantee under the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act from the ATSB in connection with the $1 billion ATSB Loan that was funded on March 31, 2003. The Company required this loan and related guarantee in order to provide the
additional liquidity necessary to carry out its 2003 Plan. US Airways is the primary obligor under the ATSB Loan, which is guaranteed by US Airways Group and each of its other domestic subsidiaries. The ATSB Loan is secured by substantially all of
the present and future assets of the US Airways Group and its subsidiaries not otherwise encumbered, other than certain specified assets, including assets which are subject to other financing agreements. As of December 31, 2004, $718 million was
outstanding under the ATSB Loan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The ATSB Loan bears interest
as follows: (i) 90% of the ATSB Loan (Tranche A) was funded through a participating lender&#146;s commercial paper conduit program and bears interest at a rate equal to the conduit provider&#146;s weighted average cost related to the issuance of
certain commercial paper notes and other short-term borrowings plus 0.30%, and (ii) 10% of the ATSB Loan (Tranche B) bears interest at LIBOR plus 4.0%. In addition, US Airways is charged an annual guarantee fee in respect of the ATSB Guarantee
currently equal to 4.1% of the ATSB&#146;s guaranteed amount (initially $900 million) under the ATSB Guarantee, with such guarantee fee increasing by ten basis points annually. Due to the Company&#146;s September 2004 bankruptcy filing and
subsequent loss of regional jet financing, the guarantee fee increased by 2% per annum and the interest rate on Tranche A and Tranche B each increased by an additional 2% and 4% per annum, respectively, for an effective increase in the interest rate
on the loan balance of 4%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with the ATSB Loan,
US Airways Group issued to ATSB Securities Trust u/a/d March 31, 2003, 7,635,000 Warrants to purchase its Class A Common Stock, together with 7,635,000 shares of Class A Preferred Stock, which makes ATSB Securities Trust u/a/d March 31, 2003 a
beneficial owner of more than five percent of the Class A Common Stock and the Class A Preferred Stock. The ATSB Securities Trust was established to hold these securities for the benefit of the United States Department of Treasury and to take action
with respect to these securities at the direction of the ATSB. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">In November 2003, the Company made a required prepayment of $24 million on the ATSB Loan in connection with the sale of its investment in Hotwire, Inc. Effective March 12, 2004, the Company entered into an amendment to the ATSB Loan that
provided for a partial prepayment of the loan and modifications of financial covenants for the measurement periods beginning June 30, 2004 through December 31, 2005. In connection with this amendment, US Airways made an immediate voluntary
prepayment of $250 million, which reduced, pro rata, all future scheduled principal payments of the ATSB Loan (rather than shortening the remaining life of the loan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective May 21, 2004, US Airways again amended the ATSB Loan to permit use of its regional jets financed by GE utilizing
mortgage debt as cross collateral for other obligations of US Airways to GE. In consideration for this amendment, US Airways agreed to certain revised covenants and conditions and made a prepayment of $5 million. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective June 30, 2004, US Airways and the ATSB amended the ATSB Loan to
remove the uncertainty relating to the Company&#146;s ability to satisfy its financial covenant tests for the second quarter of 2004. In consideration for this amendment, the Company agreed to change the loan amortization schedule, by increasing
each of the first six principal repayment installments commencing on October 1, 2006 by approximately $16 million, and reducing the last principal repayment installment on October 1, 2009 by $94 million. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">143 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has entered into a Cash Collateral Agreement, which has been subsequently extended, with the
approval of the Bankruptcy Court, for the continued use of the cash securing the ATSB Loan. The initial agreement was extended until January 15, 2005 and the current agreement, subject to certain conditions and limitations will expire on June 30,
2005. Under the Cash Collateral Agreement, the Company is required to maintain a certain amount of unrestricted cash each week. For more information about the Cash Collateral Agreement, see Part I, Item 7. &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operation &#150; Liquidity and Capital Resources. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retirement Systems of Alabama Holdings LLC. </I>In connection with the consummation of the 2003 Plan, RSA made an equity investment in US Airways Group
equal to $240 million. In exchange for the $240 million investment, RSA received 20,652,593 shares of Class A Common Stock, 5,000,000 shares of Class B Common Stock, 75,000 shares of Class B Preferred Stock, 1,380,570 Warrants and 1,380,570 shares
of Class A Preferred Stock, representing approximately 36.2%, on a fully-diluted basis, of US Airways Group&#146;s equity. As of February 1, 2005, in connection with its investment, RSA held a voting interest of approximately 71.7% in US Airways
Group and is entitled to designate and vote to elect eight of the 15 directors on US Airways Group&#146;s board of directors. Additionally, Dr. David G. Bronner and Mr. William T. Stephens, two of the Company&#146;s directors, are the Manager and
Secretary of RSA, respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Until September 26, 2007, RSA
has agreed to vote all of the shares of voting capital stock received in connection with the consummation of the 2003 Plan and then owned by it in favor of all of the directors nominated in accordance with the investment agreement between US Airways
Group and RSA, which directors include the Company&#146;s chief executive officer, four directors nominated by the various unions and their affiliates, and two directors identified by the Company&#146;s chief executive officer, neither of whom is an
employee or affiliate of the Company, at each annual meeting of US Airways Group&#146;s stockholders or at any meeting of the stockholders at which members of the Board of Directors are to be elected. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RSA funded $75 million of the non-guaranteed portion of the ATSB Loan. In
connection with RSA&#146;s partial funding, it received 636,249 additional Warrants and 636,249 additional shares of Class A Preferred Stock. With respect to the prepayments of the ATSB Loan, RSA, as one of the lenders under the ATSB Loan, has
received prepayments totaling $21 million through December 31, 2004, which represented its pro rata portion of the prepayment amount based on the percentage of the original aggregate amount of the ATSB Loan that RSA funded. As of December 31, 2004,
$54 million was outstanding under RSA&#146;s portion of the ATSB Loan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Additionally, in connection with the execution and delivery of the ATSB Loan, RSA executed an undertaking for the benefit of the ATSB. RSA agreed that until April 1, 2005, it shall not transfer any of its shares of Class A Common Stock,
other than pursuant to or in connection with certain approved transactions specified in the undertaking. Notwithstanding restrictions against transfer set forth above, RSA may make one or more transfers of securities, provided that the aggregate
number of securities subject to such transfers may in no event exceed 6,195,778 shares of Class A Common Stock; this number of shares represents 30% of its Class A Common Stock and will be adjusted for stock splits, reverse stock splits and other
similar actions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RSA also agreed that for so long as it holds
any shares of Class B Common Stock, it will not, directly or indirectly, in any manner effect or seek, offer or propose to effect, or cause or participate in or in any way assist any other person to effect or seek, offer or propose to effect or
participate in (i) any acquisition of all or substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets, (ii) any tender or exchange offer, merger or other business combination involving the Company, or (iii) any recapitalization, restructuring, liquidation,
dissolution or other extraordinary transaction with respect to the Company, in any of the foregoing cases where the transaction provides or would provide for disparate consideration or economic rights between the holders of the Class A Common Stock
and the Class B Common Stock. This provision terminates in certain circumstances, as more fully described in the undertaking. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">144 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="tx71940_37"></A>Item&nbsp;14.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Principal Accountant Fees and Services </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Audit and Non-Audit Fees </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Aggregate fees for professional services rendered for the Company by KPMG LLP as of or for the fiscal years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003 are set forth
below. The aggregate fees included in the Audit category are fees <I>for </I>the fiscal years for the audit of the Company&#146;s annual financial statements and review of quarterly financial statements and statutory and regulatory filings or
engagements. The aggregate fees included in each of the other categories are fees billed <I>in </I>the fiscal years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Audit Fees </I>for
the fiscal years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003 were for professional services rendered for the audits of the annual financial statements, the audit of internal control over financial reporting (2004) and quarterly review of the financial
statements included in the Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, including bankruptcy related transactions and the adoption of fresh start reporting (2003). Audit fees also include statutory audits and consents to the use of audit reports in SEC filings.
<I> </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Audit-Related Fees </I>as of the fiscal years ended
December 31, 2004 and 2003 were for audits of employee benefit plans and other audit related services. <I> </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Tax Fees </I>as of the fiscal years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003 were for tax compliance advice related primarily to bankruptcy matters, change of
ownership and review of tax returns. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There were no fees which
fall into the classification of<I> All Other Fees </I>as of the fiscal years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003. <U></U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Policy on Audit Committee Pre-Approval of Audit and Permissible Non-Audit Services </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Commencing in May 2003, with the effectiveness of new rules adopted under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Audit
Committee established a practice of pre-approving all services (audit and non-audit) provided by the Company&#146;s independent auditors and is responsible for determining whether these services are consistent with the auditor&#146;s independence.
The Audit Committee adopted a pre-approval policy in May 2003 that provides guidelines for the audit, audit-related, tax and other non-audit services that may be provided to the Company by its independent auditors. The policy requires the
pre-approval of all services at a meeting of the Audit Committee or through the following detailed process: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">submission by the independent auditors of a detailed description of the audit or non-audit service being requested by management, including an engagement fee or range of fees for
the service; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the Company&#146;s analysis and certification that the services are not prohibited services under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and related rules or regulations;
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the Company&#146;s certification that the services are compatible with the auditors&#146; independence requirements; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the review and approval of one authorized member of management (either the General Counsel or the Executive Vice President - Finance and Chief Financial Officer)
before </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">145 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="tx71940_40"></A>Exhibits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Exhibits required to be
filed by Item 601 of Regulation S-K. Where the amount of securities authorized to be issued under any of the Company&#146;s long-term debt agreements does not exceed 10 percent of the Company&#146;s assets, pursuant to paragraph (b)(4)(iii) of Item
601 of Regulation S-K, in lieu of filing such as an exhibit, the Company hereby agrees to furnish to the Commission upon request a copy of any agreement with respect to such long-term debt. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>

<TD WIDTH="89%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Designation</B></FONT><BR><HR WIDTH="63" SIZE="1" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Description</B></FONT></P><HR WIDTH="61" SIZE="1" NOSHADE ALIGN="left" COLOR="#000000"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">First Amended Joint Plan of Reorganization of US Airways Group and Its Affiliated Debtors and Debtors-in-Possession, As Modified (incorporated by reference to Exhibit 2.1 to US Airways
Group&#146;s Current Report on Form 8-K dated March 18, 2003)</FONT></TD></TR>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.9
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>EXHIBIT 10.9</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.9 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">November 24, 2004 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways Group, Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2345 Crystal Drive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Arlington, VA 22227 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways, Inc.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2345 Crystal Drive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Arlington, VA 22227 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">General Electric Capital Corporation </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c/o GE Capital Aviation Services, Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">201 High Ridge Road </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Stamford, CT 06927-4900 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Re:</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Master Memorandum of Understanding (&#147;<U>Master MOU</U>&#148;) among US Airways, Inc. (including, as the context may require, as reorganized pursuant to the Bankruptcy Code,
&#147;<U>US Airways</U>&#148;), US Airways Group, Inc. (including, as the context may require, as reorganized pursuant to the Bankruptcy Code, &#147;<U>Group</U>&#148;), and General Electric Capital Corporation, acting through its agent GE Capital
Aviation Services, Inc. (&#147;<U>GECC</U>&#148;; and together with GE Capital Aviation Services, Inc. &#147;<U>GECAS</U>&#148;, GE Engine Services, Inc. &#147;<U>GE Engine Services</U>&#148; and General Electric Company, GE Transportation Component
&#147;<U>GEAE</U>&#148; and their respective affiliates, the &#147;<U>GE Entities</U>&#148;) </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Gentlemen/Ladies: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Master MOU, when
countersigned by the respective parties, shall set forth our understanding with respect to a restructuring of the indebtedness and obligations of US Airways and Group to the GE Entities, which understanding was reached in separate negotiations with
each of such respective parties in connection with the related matters contained herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In conjunction with the bankruptcy proceedings of Group and certain of its subsidiaries (including US Airways) under Chapter 11, Title 11 of the United States Code (the &#147;<U>Chapter 11 Case</U>&#148;) commenced on
September 12, 2004 (the &#147;<U>Petition Date</U>&#148;) in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Eastern District of Virginia, Alexandria Division (the &#147;<U>Bankruptcy Court</U>&#148;), US Airways wishes to obtain and GECAS is willing to
provide (both during the Chapter 11 Case and upon emergence pursuant to a plan of reorganization (&#147;<U>Plan of Reorganization</U>&#148;) confirmed by the Bankruptcy Court) the following: (i) certain lease modifications with respect to certain
GECC aircraft leased to US Airways as described in <U>Exhibit A</U>; (ii) certain lease and other arrangements in respect </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of future regional jet acquisitions by US Airways (the &#147;<U>Regional Jet Lease Transactions</U>&#148;) as described in <U>Exhibit B</U>; (iii) certain
sale-leaseback transactions as described in <U>Exhibit C</U>; (iv) certain modifications to the financing evidenced by the Credit Agreement dated as of November 16, 2001 among US Airways, as Borrower, GECC, as Lender and Group, as Guarantor (as
amended, supplemented and modified, the &#147;<U>2001 Facility</U>&#148;) and the Exit Liquidity Facility Agreement dated as of March 31, 2003 among US Airways, as Borrower, GECC, as Lender and Group, as Guarantor (as supplemented and modified, the
&#147;<U>2003 Liquidity Facility</U>&#148;) as described in <U>Exhibit D</U>; (v) a new bridge financing facility as further described in <U>Exhibit E</U> (the &#147;<U>Bridge Facility</U>&#148;); and (vi) waiver of registration penalties for the
<B>[REDACTED]</B> EETC as described in <U>Exhibit F</U>. In consideration of the foregoing, US Airways has agreed to issue certain Convertible Notes to a GE Entity upon emergence from the Chapter 11 Case, the terms of which are described in
<U>Exhibit G</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, US Airways wishes to obtain certain
modifications with respect to certain of its contracts with GE Engine Services and GEAE, and GE Engine Services and GEAE are willing to modify such provisions of such contracts with US Airways, as further described in <U>Exhibit H</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of these transactions and modifications is to occur pursuant to the terms and
conditions set forth in the following applicable term sheets attached as <U>Exhibits A</U> <U>through H</U> (each, a &#147;<U>Term Sheet</U>&#148; and, collectively, the &#147;<U>Term Sheets</U>&#148;). Certain of the transactions and modifications
described in the Term Sheets are scheduled to take effect upon judicial approval of the Master MOU no later than December 17, 2004 or described in the attached term sheets as a Phase I Transaction (the &#147;<U>Phase I Transactions</U>&#148;);
others are scheduled to take effect on January 18, 2004 or described in the attached term sheets as a Phase II Transaction (the &#147;<U>Phase II Transactions</U>&#148;); and others are scheduled to take effect upon US Airways&#146; exit from
bankruptcy or described in the attached term sheets as an Exit Transaction (the &#147;Exit Transactions&#148; and, together with the Phase I Transactions and the Phase II Transactions, the &#147;<U>Restructuring Transactions</U>&#148;). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="90%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The parties further acknowledge and agree that (i) the Restructuring Transactions contemplated in this Master MOU are
comprised of several separate interrelated transactions (each of which is individually described in its respective Term Sheet), and (ii) each Phase I Transaction and Phase II Transaction is expressly conditioned upon the consummation of every other
Phase I Transaction and Phase II Transaction. In no event shall any Term Sheet be viewed as a stand-alone transaction. Accordingly, each of the transactions and modifications contemplated by the Term Sheets must be evidenced by executed definitive
agreements in order to effectuate the Restructuring Transactions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of the
Phase I Transactions, the Phase II Transactions and the Exit Restructuring Transactions shall only take effect on the effective dates and, in each case subject to the satisfaction of applicable conditions, for such transactions (whether such
conditions are provided for in the schedules to this Master MOU or in the applicable Term Sheet). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each and every obligation of US Airways and Group to a GE Entity, or to another party where nonperformance of such obligation could impose an obligation on a GE Entity, which may be created under this Master MOU and
the Term Sheets (such obligations of US Airways and Group, the &#147;<U>US Airways Restructuring Obligations</U>&#148;) will be (i) cross-defaulted to each and every US Airways Restructuring Obligation unless such cross-default has specifically been
waived by the affected GE Entity or in the Term Sheets and (ii) cross-defaulted with the cash collateral order in respect of the existing loan guaranteed by the Air Transportation Stabilization Board (the &#147;<U>ATSB</U>&#148;) in accordance with
the Air Carrier Guarantee Loan Program (the &#147;<U>ATSB Loan</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Each of the parties hereto acknowledges that this Master MOU and the related Term Sheets contain commercially sensitive and proprietary information. Each of the parties agrees to keep this information strictly confidential and agrees to
disclose it to no person other than: (A) their respective board(s) of directors; (B) employees working on the subject matter of this Master MOU; (C) professional advisors advising them concerning the subject matter of this Master MOU provided that
US Airways and such outside professional advisors execute a confidentiality agreement in form and substance acceptable to GECC and GE Engine Services; (D) the ATSB, provided that US Airways shall use commercially reasonable efforts to prevent
disclosure of such information under the Freedom of Information Act; (E) the Bankruptcy Court during the course of the Chapter 11 Case, <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that no document shall be filed with the Bankruptcy Court unless either there
has been obtained prior to the filing thereof an order of the Bankruptcy Court enabling US Airways to file those portions of the documents under seal or portions of such filed documents designated by GECC are redacted, in each case, as GECC shall
request in its sole discretion; (F) the professional advisors of the Official Committee of Unsecured Creditors (the &#147;<U>Creditors&#146; Committee</U>&#148;), but only to the extent that designated portions of such material to be disclosed are
redacted, in each case, as GECC shall request in its sole discretion, members of the Creditors&#146; Committee, and (G) any potential debtor-in-possession (&#147;<U>DIP</U>&#148;) lender and equity investors provided that such entities shall, in
each case prior to disclosure, execute a confidentiality agreement in form and substance acceptable to GECC and GEAE. A written summary of the Restructuring </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Transaction, approved by GECC in advance of disclosing such summary, may be provided to (i) US Airways&#146; and Group&#146;s labor unions, (ii) any lender,
potential lender, or participant, (iii) any material stakeholder in US Airways&#146; and Group&#146;s proposed restructuring, (iv) the Creditors&#146; Committee (but only if such summary has been redacted in a manner satisfactory to GECC as provided
above) or (v) such other third parties as the parties hereto may mutually agree; provided that such parties described in (i) &#150; (v) above have executed a confidentiality agreement in form and substance acceptable to GECC and GE Engine Services.
The parties agree that the terms of this Paragraph will survive any termination, through expiration or otherwise, of the Term Sheets that are the subject hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to the conditions set forth in <U>Schedule A</U>, <U>Schedule B</U> and <U>Schedule C</U> hereto with respect to the Phase I
Transactions, the Phase II Transactions and the Exit Restructuring Transactions, this Master MOU and the Term Sheets are intended to create binding legal obligations among the parties. Reference is made to the milestones and events described in
<U>Schedule D</U> hereto (as the same may be amended, each a &#147;<U>Global Event of Default</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Master MOU may not be modified or amended in any manner other than in writing duly executed by or on behalf of all of the parties hereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Once this Master MOU has been countersigned, the parties will proceed to finalize appropriate definitive agreements and to commence the
other steps that will be necessary or appropriate to complete the transactions contemplated by the Term Sheets. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Master MOU may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed to be an original, and such counterparts together shall
constitute and be one and the same instrument. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">[Signature pages
follow.] </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>

SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, this Master MOU was entered into the day and year first above written. </FONT></P> <P

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Schedule A
</U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Phase I Transaction Conditions </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Consummation of each Phase I Transaction. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Satisfactory negotiation, review and agreement of definitive documentation, including legal review, for the Phase I Transactions in form and substance acceptable to US Airways and
Group on the one hand and to GECAS, GECC, GE Engine Services, or GEAE, as applicable on the other hand. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Bring-down due diligence (including, but not limited to, credit analysis, business review, legal review and review of capital, operating structure (including mainline and regional
operations)) respecting US Airways and Group satisfactory to GECAS, GECC, GE Engine Services, or GEAE, as applicable, in their sole discretion. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval by the Bankruptcy Court of all transactions on or before December 17, 2004, which order (a) shall be in form and substance acceptable to GECC in its sole discretion and (b)
shall not be subject to an appeal, motion for rehearing or reconsideration or petition for writ of certiorari and the time to file such appeal, motion or petition shall have expired. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payment or reimbursement of all reasonable costs and expenses, including without limitation, reasonable legal fees (including legal fees accruing prior to the Petition Date) of the
GE Entities to date. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Schedule B
</U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Phase II Transaction Conditions </U></FONT></P> <P

SIZE="2"><B>Amounts:</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon US Airways&#146; emergence from the Chapter 11 Case, a pre-emergence &#147;true-up&#148; payment for rent accrued and unpaid from the last payment date on the Boeing SIL Transactions to the
date immediately prior to the emergence date shall be made at a monthly lease rental rate of $<B>[REDACTED]</B> per month per aircraft, pro rated for partial months. From and after the date of US Airways&#146; emergence from the Chapter 11 Case, the
monthly lease rental rates for the Boeing SIL Transactions shall be paid in advance, pro rated for partial months, and in the amount of $<B>[REDACTED]</B> per month per aircraft. Upon the next payment date after emergence, in respect of the B737-400
single investor lease aircraft, rents shall be paid in advance, pro rated for partial months in the amount of $<B>[REDACTED]</B> per month per aircraft. All amounts noted above reflect the average monthly lease rate across the relevant fleet with
variations for individual aircraft within each fleet.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>B737-400 SIL Restructure</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B>Option:</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">GECC will provide US Airways with the option to restructure any number of the B737-400 single investor leases to monthly rentals (payable in advance) of $<B>[REDACTED]</B> at sixty (60), ninety
(90) or one hundred-eighty (180) days following the issuance of Convertible Notes, for cash or Convertible Notes of equal market value under the indicative pricing schedule contained on Schedule E to the Exhibit A.</FONT></TD></TR>

not otherwise defined herein shall have the respective meanings ascribed to such terms in the Master MOU. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Confidential </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SCHEDULE A TO

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Regional Jet Lease Transactions Term Sheet </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">GECC, acting through its agent GECAS and/or its subsidiary, affiliate, associated company or assignees (&#147;<U>Lessor</U>&#148;).</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Up to thirty-one (31) regional jet aircraft to be acquired by US Airways or via the GECAS order stream. The aircraft to be leased will consist of 70- to 100-seat regional jet aircraft
manufactured by Bombardier and/or Embraer in a mix and other terms to be agreed mutually by GECC and US Airways.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Of the aircraft noted above, GECC will lease to US Airways six (6) CRJ-700s beginning between January 18, 2005 and February 28, 2005 and ending the earlier of (i) the date of emergence from the
Chapter 11 Case or (ii) June 30, 2005 and cross-defaults shall include the occurrence of a Global Event of Default. Each lease will be a post-petition agreement, but only rent payable through June 30, 2005 (as the parties may agree to extend) and
return condition obligations shall be afforded administrative expense status, and all other claims under such lease, including rejection damage claims, would be unsecured pre-petition claims. The leases will be extended upon emergence from
the</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD WIDTH="71%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

Airways&#146; mainline fleet.</FONT></TD></TR>

amended &#147;<U>RJ Leasing Agreement</U>&#148;) pursuant to which GECC will provide the Lease Transactions on terms consistent with the single-investor lease transactions described therein with changes to reflect the terms of this Exhibit B and
other modifications as required by GECC and acceptable to US Airways; the obligations under the reinstated RJ Leasing Agreement shall not be afforded administrative expense status.</FONT></TD></TR>

not otherwise defined herein shall have the respective meanings ascribed to such terms in the Master MOU. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Purchaser will purchase (i) the collateral securing the 2001 Facility: three (3) A319 aircraft, three (3) A320 aircraft, five (5) A321 aircraft, fourteen (14) CFM56- 5B spare engines and
fourteen (14) CFM56-3B spare engines and (ii) nine (9) CRJ-200 aircraft and one (1) CRJ-700 aircraft, that are currently mortgage debt financed by GECC, for $640.42 million, pricing assumes the inclusion of engine stands (to the extent included in
the 2001 Facility collateral) and eight (8) full QEC kits for the CFM56-5B6 with a purchase price adjustment to be mutually agreed to half-life/half-time conditions of the spare engines at the closing (the &#147;<U>Purchase
Price</U>&#148;).</FONT></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) second, the GE mortgage debt financing for the CRJs (the &#147;<U>RJ Loans</U>&#148;); and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) third, the 2001 Facility (assuming no purchase price adjustments, leaving a stipulated and agreed loan balance of $14.99
million).</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) CRJ-200 and CRJ-700: per the terms noted in Exhibit B hereto and assuming a purchase of $<B>[REDACTED]</B> million for each CRJ-200 and $<B>[REDACTED]</B> million for each CRJ-700, as
adjusted for delivery condition.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

agreed, but in general will allow for half life/half time return conditions for aircraft and same-in/same-out for engines with financial adjustments for differences in actual return conditions but subject to minimum redelivery conditions
<B>[REDACTED]</B>. Leases will be cross-defaulted to any obligation to any GE Entity (other than Excepted Obligations), including any Global Event of Default. Documentation for aircraft to be modeled after the existing leases relating to the
aircraft listed in Schedule B to Exhibit A. Documentation for engine leases to be modeled after the existing leases relating to the aircraft listed in Schedule B to Exhibit A, with appropriate changes for a spare engine operating lease. Each lease
will be a post-petition agreement, but only rent payable through June 30, 2005 (as the parties may agree to extend) and return condition obligations shall be afforded administrative expense status, and all other</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Lender will make liquidity loans available to Borrower (the &#147;<U>Bridge Facility Loans</U>&#148;) as described on Schedule A hereto. The facility will be cross-collateralized and
cross-defaulted with all other GE Entity obligations and will be stipulated and approved as an administrative claim with priority over all other administrative claims other than for aircraft financing deferrals, which shall be pari passu, and only
subordinate to &#147;superpriority&#148; administrative claims of the ATSB Loan (including the carve-outs contained therein), post-petition wages and benefits, and new money DIP financing.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each disbursement will be made on the drawdown date specified therefore in Schedule A and Borrower will be deemed to have executed and delivered the Borrowing Notice, unless Borrower notifies
Lender to the contrary in writing prior to the LIBOR Setting Date (defined below).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>

below.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Interest:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Bridge Facility Note shall bear floating rate interest quarterly in arrears based on the average outstanding daily balance of the Bridge Facility during the preceding quarter. The annual
interest rate shall be computed as the sum of (i) three-month US Dollar LIBOR, as quoted on Bloomberg Page BBAM 1 (British Bankers Association page) on the applicable LIBOR Setting Date&#148; and (ii) 4.25%, and such interest rate shall accrue on an
actual/360 basis. Interest may be paid in US dollars or in kind at the option of Borrower during the Chapter 11 Case. The &#147;<U>LIBOR Setting Date</U>&#148; shall be the date which is two (2) Business Days in advance of the applicable three-month
LIBOR period.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD WIDTH="71%"></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Mandatory</U>: Upon the acceleration of the Bridge Facility following an Event of Default (as defined below), Borrower will prepay all amounts outstanding under the Bridge
Facility.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Event&nbsp;of&nbsp;Default:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An event of default will occur if, among other customary events, any of the following occurs, and is continuing (&#147;<U>Event of Default</U>&#148;):</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to make any payment of principal when due under any Bridge Facility Note or failure to make any payment
of interest, fees or other amounts and such failure shall continue unremedied for a period of five (5) business days or more;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Breach of any covenant in any material respect under the Bridge Facility, and such breach remains unremedied
after a cure period which shall be determined;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Breach or Event of Default of any cash collateral order in respect of the ATSB Loan or any default under the
ATSB Loan (irrespective of whether the ATSB has waived or acted upon such breach or default);</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Events of Default that occur and continue with respect to the US Airways Restructuring Obligations or material
Events of Default that occur and continue with respect to any other agreement between US Airways or Group and any GE Entity;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The occurrence of an Event of Default under the 2001 Facility, the 2003 Liquidity Facility (if not repaid) or a
Global Event of Default;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other appropriate and customary events of default;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entry of an order authorizing the conversion of the Chapter 11 Case into a Chapter 7 liquidation or the
implementation of a</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">17 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">liquidation in the Chapter 11 Case;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entry of an order authorizing the appointment of a Trustee or an examiner with expanded powers in connection
with the Chapter 11 Case;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entry of an order authorizing the sale of all or substantially all of Borrower&#146;s assets unless
consummated as part of a plan of reorganization and contemplated by the Restructuring Documentation;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Suspension of all or substantially all of Borrower&#146;s flight and other operations or entry of an order
authorizing the same; or</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Filing of a motion by the debtor in the Chapter 11 Case to effectuate (g), (h), (i) or (j).</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Bridge Facility may be accelerated in full within five (5) business days of an Event of Default and Borrower will be required to pay Lender all principal and interest payments then due
and owing plus other enforcement costs, if any.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Representations,</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Warranties and</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Covenants:</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The documentation with respect to the Bridge Facility will contain representations, warranties and covenants (which will be applicable to US Airways, Group and any of their respective
subsidiaries) customarily found in the loan agreements of GECAS or GECC, as applicable, for similar financings.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Conditions&nbsp;Precedent to Closing:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The conditions to the closing of the Bridge Facility transaction will include those on Schedules A and B to the Master MOU.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Conditions Precedent to Drawdown:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Draw-downs under the Bridge Facility shall be, in each case, subject to certain customary conditions and no occurrence of an Event of Default (other than any Excepted Obligations), including
a Global Event of Default.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All capitalized terms used herein, but
not otherwise defined herein shall have the respective meanings ascribed to such terms in the Master MOU. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18 </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT F </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>[REDACTED] EETC Term Sheet </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PART 1 &#150; PHASE I TRANSACTIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reference is made to that certain Registration Agreement dated as of <B>[REDACTED]</B>, by and between US Airways and <B>[REDACTED]</B>, and agreed to by
<B>[REDACTED]</B>, solely in its capacity as trustee of the US Airways Pass Through Trust <B>[REDACTED]</B> (the &#147;<U>Registration Agreement</U>&#148;), which requires US Airways to prepare and file a Registration Statement (as defined in the
Registration Agreement) in order to effect an offer to exchange GECC&#146;s holdings of US Airways <B>[REDACTED]</B> Pass Through Certificates, Series <B>[REDACTED]</B> (the &#147;<U>Certificates</U>&#148;) for substantially similar certificates.
During the Chapter 11 Case, step-up interest rate is to be waived on the Certificates (in accordance with the terms of the Registration Agreement) (such interest rate, the &#147;<U>Step-up Interest Rate</U>&#148;) until six (6) months after US
Airways&#146; emergence from the Chapter 11 Case. US Airways&#146; obligations under the Registration Agreement, as modified, shall be assumed pursuant to Section 365 of the Bankruptcy Code or reinstated pursuant to the Plan of Reorganization no
later than the date of the consummation of the Plan of Reorganization. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PART
2 &#150; EXIT TRANSACTIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon US Airways&#146;
emergence from the Chapter 11 Case, GECC will agree to extend, until six (6) months after the date of such emergence from the Chapter 11 Case (the &#147;<U>Extension Period</U>&#148;), the deadline with respect to the exercise of the right to
require registration, pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Registration Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All capitalized terms used herein, but not otherwise defined herein shall have the respective meanings ascribed to such terms in the Master MOU. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">20 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT G </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Convertible Note Term Sheet </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXIT TRANSACTION </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="5%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways, Inc., as reorganized pursuant to the Bankruptcy Code.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">[___]%* Senior Convertible Notes Due 2020 (the &#147;Notes&#148;) issued on the Issuer&#146;s emergence from the Chapter 11 Case.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A GE affiliate.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Principal&nbsp;Amount:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$125,000,000 in denominations of $1,000.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Term:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fifteen (15) years from issuance.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Amortization:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">None prior to maturity; full principal to be repaid at the maturity date except to the extent converted or prepaid.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Interest Rate:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Semi-annually in arrears, in cash, at an annual rate of [___]%*.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Security:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">None.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Ranking:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Notes are senior unsecured obligations and rank equally in right of payment with all existing and future senior unsecured obligations of Issuer. The Notes are senior unsecured and thus
are junior to Issuer&#146;s secured obligations to the extent of the value of the collateral securing such secured obligation.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Conversion&nbsp;Rights:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Holder may convert any number of the Notes into the Issuer&#146;s common stock (the &#147;<U>Common Stock</U>&#148;), at any time, at the Conversion Price.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Conversion Price:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The product of (x) 140-150% (at Issuer&#146;s option) and (y) the average closing price of the Common Stock for the sixty (60)</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE><HR WIDTH="8%" SIZE="1" NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" ALIGN="left">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The parties will work together to set a coupon rate for the Notes no later than thirty (30) days prior to the scheduled date of emergence from the Chapter 11 Case which would be
reasonably expected to result in the Notes trading at par upon emergence from the Chapter 11 Case (the &#147;<U>Par Value Interest Rate</U>&#148;). Failing agreement on the Par Value Interest Rate, the parties will solicit rate recommendation from
three national trading firms and will adopt the average of the three suggested rates. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">21 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="8%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">consecutive trading days following Issuer&#146;s emergence from the Chapter 11 Case and listing on NASDAQ or a national stock exchange from the Chapter 11 Case.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Transferability:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Notes will be issued under 11 U.S.C. &#167;1145 upon the Issuer&#146;s emergence from the Chapter 11 Case; the Notes and the underlying Common Stock will be freely transferable by the
Holders without registration under the Securities Act of 1933.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Common&nbsp;Stock:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">When delivered, the underlying Common Stock will be fully paid and non-assessable and listed on a national stock exchange by one hundred-eighty (180) days following emergence from the Chapter
11 Case. Failure to achieve such listing within one hundred-eighty (180) days of the date of emergence from the Chapter 11 Case will result in customary liquidated damages (i.e., increase in interest rate).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Call Rights:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">No call for five (5) years; thereafter, callable, at the option of the Issuer, in (a) cash or (b) Common Stock if the Common Stock has traded at no less than 115% of the Conversion Price for
twenty (20) of the thirty (30) trading days prior to the call date.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Put Rights:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Soft&#148; put right for principal and accrued interest, payable in cash or Common Stock at the option of the Issuer, on the fifth (5</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">) and tenth (10</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">)
anniversary of issuance.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Mandatory<BR>Prepayments:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mandatory repayment at upon a &#147;fundamental corporate change&#148; with a customary coupon make-whole for public market convertible debt securities of this type.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Anti-Dilution<BR>Protections:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Conversion Price will be subject to customary anti-dilution adjustments, including, without limitation, upon (i) stock or cash dividends, (ii) reclassifications, subdivisions or
combinations of the Common Stock, (iii) the issuance of convertible securities, rights or warrants to all holders of Common Stock convertible into or exercisable for Common Stock at less than the then-current market price, (iv) purchases of Common
Stock in a tender offer at more than the then-current market price, (v) distribution of the capital stock of an Issuer subsidiary to holders of the Common Stock and (vi) any other distributions of assets or securities by the Issuer to holders of the
Common Stock.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Business<BR>Combinations:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Notes will enjoy customary adjustments and protections if the Common Stock is converted into, reclassified into or</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">22 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="7%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">exchanged for cash, assets or securities.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Other&nbsp;Terms&nbsp;and<BR>Conditions:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Notes are intended to be public market securities and to trade at par value when issued. Documentation of the Notes will include the terms and conditions customarily found in public
market convertible securities of this type.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">23 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
